greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime P such that P# - Mersenne-prime(n) is prime.
mathematica: mexp = {the list in A000043}; Primorial[n_] := Product[ Prime[i], {i, n}]; f[n_] := Block[{k = 1}, While[Primorial[k] < 2^mexp[[n]] || !PrimeQ[ Primorial[k] - 2^mexp[[n]] + 1], k++ ]; Prime[k]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 15}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 28 2004 *)
results.author: _Pierre CAMI_, Sep 15 2004
ext: Corrected by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 28 2004
